parameters: \pop[3]You know that promotion I've been aiming to get?
I just scored an interview with the higher-ups at \c[23]Argus\c[0]!
\pop[3]That is the exact \c[14]opposite\c[0] of what you said last time.
\pop[3]Yeah. Don't think we forgot about that one, Dante.
Either way, I'm looking forward to the treat that you promised~
\pop[3]Dante took some shots at Isaac last time he talked about this promotion.
Something about not trusting Isaac with more responsibility.
\pop[3]Exactly. That's why Dante doesn't get a treat.
This type of thing is only for Isaac's \c[14]best\c[0] friends.
\pop[4]You weren't even there when it happened.
Or were you just trying to tease Dante?
\pop[3]You know, I haven't even thought about it.
But this is a \c[14]big\c[0] promotion. It'll require a \c[14]big\c[0] celebration.
Just hope that Isaac gets the job, it's not that hard.
Everything will be better if he does. More money, more power.
I hope you get the job, Isaac; and I'm sorry.
Don't you think the timing of this is a little odd, though?
Probably the hardest I've ever worked.
You step on their toes, and they invite you to their HQ?
He didn't believe in me then, and he doesn't now.
\pop[3]Why is this so hard for you, then...?
\pop[4]Look. You know I care about you, Isaac.
I'm just pointing out that the timing is a little odd.
Isaac looked into this already, remember?
There hasn't been any heat on us. Not even a little.
\pop[3]Your worries are founded, but you're killing the vibe.
We should be happy for Isaac, not filling him with fright.
\pop[3]It's okay. I'm not scared, and I know we're gonna be fine.
In fact, I can even use this interview to prove it!
\pop[3]Let's see if I can explain this in a non-tech way.
Back at work, I actually outrank the PC's we use. They hold me back.
But at \c[23]Argus\c[0] HQ, I can take \c[14]full\c[0] advantage of my security clearance.
All the power is within \c[23]Argus\c[0]' headquarters.
Retail outlets only get a fraction of that.
\pop[3]Then how do you know we're really safe?
All the data on us could be at a higher level.
\pop[3]I can see enough at work to give me peace of mind.
But I can take a look at \c[23]Argus\c[0]' HQ for \c[14]your\c[0] sake.
Anything I can do to make you less worried.
\pop[4]Like how you gave Kyron social media and stuff?
Are you sure you won't get in trouble for this?
\pop[3]Most people would. But remember who you're dealing with.
I can cover my tracks \c[14]better\c[0] than the best in the business.
Snooping around in their own HQ?
Always thought you'd be more timid in the end.
\pop[3]Nah. This is where I'm the \c[14]most\c[0] confident.
Hopefully after this, you'll start to trust my abilities.
\pop[4]If it's truly just an interview, then I'll yield forever.
But until then, I believe a \c[14]tiny\c[0] bit of paranoia is justified.
So I can tell you all about it at the tavern.
I'm pretty sure it'll be multiple interviews, too.
\pop[4]Multiple interviews...? I hope you get called back, then.
What position are you up for, exactly?
\pop[3]It's actually a step above my current boss.
He runs \c[14]one\c[0] store, but they want me overseeing multiple.
I'd basically just sit in their HQ, and monitor the district's sales numbers.
\pop[3]Yeah, he's not interested in all that extra stuff.
In fact, he \c[14]personally\c[0] recommended me for the promotion.
So like I said, I'm pretty sure I earned this. It's not a trick.
\pop[4]I'm starting to believe, I'll say that much.
Just give us an update on Friday, and I'll look forward to it.
In fact, I can't wait to party with some peace of mind.
\pop[3]Yeah. Talk about a night to remember~
